thread.title: Germany’s Merkel: ‘We need the military strength’ of the USA to defeat Islamist terrorism
thread.title_full: Germany’s Merkel: ‘We need the military strength’ of the USA to defeat Islamist terrorism

author: William A.
title: Germany’s Merkel: ‘We need the military strength’ of the USA to defeat Islamist terrorism
text:
2017: The Swedish Embassy is now trolling President Trump on Twitter 
Quote from story: 
The case provoked outrage in Germany after it was caught on security cameras. After police released photos of the suspected attackers, six of them later turned themselves over to the police , another was arrested. All seven have been in police custody since December 27. Their motives for the attack are still unknown. 
Because all seven alleged perpetrators came to Germany as refugees – six from Syria, one from Libya – the attack sparked a debate over the integration of so-called “unaccompanied minors” seeking refugee status in Germany and stirred anti-migrant sentiments. 
Another story: 
— dwnews (@dwnews) February 15, 2017 
Quote: 
The suspect had presented an identification document showing he was an asylum seeker, Swiss authorities said. The Nigerian is believed to be involved in the murder of a 22-year-old volunteer at a German refugee center. 
And this story from the NY Times about an event in Germany: 2 arrested in Germany on suspicion of plotting attack; "extraordinarily important blow against the Islamist scene" https://t.co/eiTRV39Q6Y pic.twitter.com/NkXP9BdAHc 
— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 9, 2017 
Deutsche Welle also covered this story: Dutch secret service: Kids from IS-territory could pose terror threat https://t.co/Al00cOarT6 pic.twitter.com/6aIoaVgjH9 
— dwnews (@dwnews) February 16, 2017 
Quote: 
Children of Dutch Islamic State fighters could pose a threat at home, a new report has suggested. The secret service has recommended treating them as “jihadi travelers” because they may have received battle training. 
Just a reminder that these types of incidents are not just overseas: Arizona man sentenced to 30 years in prison in Prophet Muhammad cartoon contest plot in Texas: https://t.co/K31NfeSchB
